did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary
did.unittitle:
Frank Snowden Hopkins Papers,
1951-1993.
did.abstract: Written works, published and unpublished, of Frank Snowden Hopkins, journalist, diplomat, and vice-president of the World Future Society.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights/Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Curator of Manuscripts and Rare Books, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Frank Snowden Hopkins Papers, Manuscripts and Rare Books Department, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p:
Acc. No. 84-36; Gift: 25 items, July 1984.
Acc. No. 86-15; Gift: 1 item, April 1986.
Acc. No. 89-38; Gift: 1 item, September 1989.
Acc. No. 89.55; Gift: 1 item, 29 November 1989.
Acc. No. 1993.48; Gift: 1 item, 19 July 1993.
Acc. No. 1994.64A; Gift: ca. 100 items, 22 August 1994.
Acc. No. 2000.23; Gift: 1,376 items, 3 June 2000.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Frank Snowden Hopkins was born 8 March 1908 in Gloucester County, Virginia, the son of Nicholas Snowden Hopkins and Selina Lloyd (Hepburn) Hopkins. He graduated with an B. A. from the College of William and Mary and received his M. A. from Columbia University. Hopkins worked for newspapers as a reporter, personnel and labor relations director and for the Maryland Drydock Company. Hopkins entered the U. S. State Department in 1945.

chronitem.event: Born to Nicholas Snowden and Selina Lloyd (Hepburn)in Gloucester County, Virginia
Graduated (B. A.) from College of William and Mary;Phi Beta Kappa
Received M. A. from Columbia University
Editorial Assistant for D. Appleton and Company
Personnel and Labor Relations Director, Maryland Drydock Company
Public Relations Officer, Stuttgart, West Germany
U. S. Consul General, Melbourne, Australia
Speech Writer, State Department-Board of Examiners for Foreign Service
Director of Fulbright Exchange Program, State Department Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs
Consultant on long- range foreign policy, Policy Planning Council
Coordinator of Chapter Affairs, World Future Society
Vice President of World Future Society

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Written works, published and unpublished, of Frank Snowden Hopkins, journalist, diplomat, and vice-president of the World Future Society. The collection contains articles written about the Foreign Service, policy papers written for the United States State Department, articles written for the World Future Society, family histories and biographies, a reminiscence of the College of William and Mary in the 1920's, and an unpublished manuscript of a novel promoting the goals and principles of the World Future Society.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into eleven series. Series 1 contains family histories and biographies; Series 2 contains speeches by Hopkins; Series 3 contains essays prepared for U.S. State Department; Series 4 contains articles by Hopkins pertaining to the foreign service; Series 5 contains articles by Hopkings pertaining to the World Future Society; and Series 6-11 contain additions to the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized by subject.

scopecontent.p: Hopkins' personal account of a Byzantine History class he took at Harvard as a Nieman fellow in 1938.

unittitle.title: International Education in Tomorrow's World: The Challenge to American Diplomacy,

scopecontent.p: Manuscript of an article written for publication in which Hopkins lays out a methodology for planning an American foreign policy to cope with foreseeable international problems.

Some Major Issues of the International Future,

scopecontent.p: A discussion of global problems and the need for planning to confront such problems.
A discussion of the methodology of future study.

scopecontent.p: A review of Robert Jastrow's The Enchanted Loomand Morton Hunt's The Universe Within: A New Science Explores the Human Mind.
Hopkins outlines a vision for the role of UNESCO in the future.
A manuscript of review of Douglas Caddy's Exploring America's Future.The review was published in the British journal Futures .

unittitle.title: Historical Trends and the Human Future,

scopecontent.p: An argument for human history as a process of everything growing closer together and a discussion of the ramifications of such a process.
